answers.answer: Hi,How are you? What other symptoms are present? Carpal tunnel syndrome occurs when the median nerve, becomes pressed or squeezed at the wrist and presents with numbness in the palm of the hand and the fingers, especially the thumb and the index and middle fingers. To confirm the diagnosis, direct clinical examination is important, Treatment may include medication, exercise and even surgery. If the symptoms persist, it is best that you have this checked by your doctor for proper management. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I'm 27 years of age and I've been noticing that on both of my hands my thumb ,pointer and middle fingers has been gong numb I don't even have to be using my hands and it happens im worried and I wanted to know what could that be from as long as I've been going to my doctor I've always gotten checked for high blood pressure, diabetes and cancer I don't what's wrong any one with advice or know what it could be please reach out .... thanks
